statistics module¶

statistics.check_index(index, a_list)[source]¶

Checks if index is within the bounds of this pixel’s data

Parameters:index (int) – the index to be checked for validity
True if index is within the bounds of this pixels domain of valid indices, False otherwise
statistics.curve_fit(x_data, y_data, x_point=None, range_percent=0.1, order=3, lower_limit_range=0, upper_limit_range=None, plot=False)[source]¶
statistics.find_zero_crossings(a_list)[source]¶

Return the zero crossings in a list of numbers.

Parameters:
  • a_list (list) – A list of numbers, either as float or int
  • Returns –
  • ---------- –
  • list – list of indices just after zero crossing
  • Examples –
  • ---------- –

    $ pixel.bias = [-12, -3, -2, 2]

    $ print pixel._find_zero_crossings(pixel.bias)

    $ [3]
